meanings.definition: relating to or characteristic of an axoneme
meanings.sent1: The axonemal structure helps in the movement of cilia.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the axonemal properties of flagella for research purposes.
meanings.sent3: The axonemal design of the tiny hairs on the cell looked like a forest of miniature trees.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was as strong and structured as an axonemal pattern.
meanings.sent5: The axonemal features of the microscopic organism were fascinating under the microscope.

meanings.definition: pertaining to the axoneme of a cilium or flagellum
meanings.sent1: The axonemal movement of the cilium helps in cell mobility.
meanings.sent2: The flagellum's axonemal structure is crucial for its function.
meanings.sent3: The axonemal dance of the flagellum under the microscope amused the researchers.
meanings.sent4: His determination to reach the finish line was as swift and precise as an axonemal motion.
meanings.sent5: The axonemal characteristics of the flagellum were clearly visible in the lab experiment.
